title: FindingNemo Extraction 2: Phenol-free Method

source.description: This protocol is adapted from Monarch® HMW DNA Extraction Kit for Cells & Blood.

source.body:
Either SDS (anionic surfactant) or CTAB (cationic surfactant) can be used in the lysis buffer.
Providing alternative surfactants in the lysis buffer may help with different cell systems that require different biochemistry.

source.description: Pellet 5 million cells in a 2 ml tube by centrifuging at 500 x g for 5 min at 4oC.
Wash with 500 μl cold PBS and centrifuge at 500 x g for 3 min at 4oC. Discard supernatant.
Resuspend well by pipette mixing in 20 μl cold PBS.

source.body: Thorough resuspension is important for next lysis step.

source.description: Add 1 ml TLB-SDS or TLB-CTAB and 100 μg RNase A (1 μl) and vortex at full speed for 5 seconds.
Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour, mix by inversion every 15 minutes.
Add 200 μg Proteinase K (10 μl). Mix by slow inversion 5 times.
Incubate at 50°C for 2 hours, mix every 30 minutes by slow inversion 3 times.
Split the lysate into 2 phase-lock gel tubes (ca. 550 ul per tube).
Add 550 μl buffer-saturated phenol to each tube containing lysate.
Place on a HulaMixer or any vertical rotator at 20 rpm for 10 minutes. If a fine emulsion has not formed after a minute gradually increase the rotation speed.
Centrifuge at 4500 rpm for 10 minutes.
Transfer the aqueous phase to another phase-lock gel tube by pouring or using a wide-bore P1000 tip.

Add 250 μl buffer-saturated phenol and 250 μl chloroform-isoamyl alcohol to each tube.
Repeat step 11-12 and continue to 15.
Transfer and combine the aqueous phase to a 2 ml tube (sample will be ca. 1 ml).

Add 1 ml chloroform-isoamyl alcohol.
Repeat step 11-12 and continue to 17.
Using a wide-bore P1000 tip, transfer the aqueous phase to a 5 ml conical tube.

source.body: Do not bring any liquid from the interface of the chloroform phase, as this will affect DNA purity in the downstream steps.

source.description: Add 0.4x volume of 5M Ammonium Acetate (ca. 400 μl). Mix by slow inversion of tube.
Add 3 clean glass beads.
Add 3 ml absolute ethanol.
Rotate the tube with a vertical rotator at 9 rpm for 5 minutes.

source.body: If a rotator is not available, hand inversion for 30-40 times can be used. Invert the tube slowly by hand so that a full inversion cycle takes 5-6 seconds.

source.description: Remove solution, taking care not to disturb bound DNA on the glass beads.
Wash bound DNA with 1 ml of 70% ethanol. Invert tube for 2-3 times and discard the ethanol.
Repeat step 23.

Insert a bead retainer to a collection tube.
Pour the beads into the bead retainer and spin for 1 s in a mini centrifuge (or the shortest time possible) to remove residual wash buffer. Keep the bead retainer.
Quickly pour the beads into a new 2 ml low-bind tube and immediately add 250 µl of elution buffer.

source.body: Do not let the beads with DNA dry out. (As an alternative, 250 μl of elution buffer can be aliquoted into a 2 ml tube prior to this step.)

source.description: Incubate at 37oC for 30 min. Gently aspirate and dispense the eluate over the glass beads at regular intervals with a wide-bore P1000 tip to aid elution.

Insert the bead retainer from step 25 into a clean 2 ml DNA low-bind tube.
Pour the beads from step 27 and centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 1 minute.

Add another 510 μl of elution buffer to the eluate from step 28 and mix with a wide-bore P1000 tip.
Leave overnight at room temperature.

source.body:
• DNA sample will be viscous, but it is important to pipette thoroughly with a wide-bore pipette tip to ensure homogenization.
  • Homogeneous DNA sample will ensure consistent output length and yield.

source.description:
Store at 4oC or continue to UL Library Preparation as per "Modified ULK001".
If only SQK-RAD004 is available, follow library preparation in "Modified RAD004" or "KrazyStarFish (KSF)".
Pellet 3 million cells in a 1.5 ml tube by centrifuging at 1000 x g for 1 min.
Wash with cold PBS (make sure all media and serum are rinsed off), spin at 1000 x g for 1 min
Add 149 μl of TLB-SDS or TLB-CTAB which has been added with 100 ug RNaseA (1 μl) and vortex at full speed for 5 seconds.

source.body: Make a master mix of the TLB if handling more than one sample.

source.description: Incubate at 37°C for 10 minutes
Add 140 μl TLB-SDS or TLB-CTAB and 200 μg Proteinase K (10 μl). Mix by slow inversion 5 times or with a P1000 wide-bore pipette tip. Incubate at 55°C for 20 minutes.

source.body: Shaking in a thermomixer at 300-700 rpm can help lysis and homogenization, especially when using more than 3 million cells.

source.description: Add 75 μl of 5M Ammonium acetate, mix well with wide-bore P1000 pipette tip or by tube inversions.
Add 3 clean glass beads to the cell lysate.
Add 275 μl of Isopropanol
Rotate the tube with a vertical rotator at 9 rpm for 5 minutes

source.body:
If using 5 million cells as input, rotate for 10 minutes.
If a rotator is not available, hand inversion for 30-40 times can be used. Invert the tube slowly by hand so that a full inversion cycle takes 4-5 seconds.

source.description: Remove and discard liquid by pipetting.
Wash bound DNA with 1 ml of 70% ethanol, invert tube 3 times, remove and discard ethanol.
Repeat wash step no. 12.

Discard the supernatant, taking care not to disturb the DNA precipitate.
It is OK to leave a small volume of liquid behind.

Insert a bead retainer to a collection tube.
Pour the beads into the bead retainer and spin for 1 s in a mini centrifuge (or the shortest time possible) to remove residual wash buffer.
Keep the bead retainer.
Quickly pour the beads into a new 2 ml low-bind tube and immediately add 200 µl of elution buffer.

source.body:
Do not let the beads with DNA dry out.
As an alternative, 200 μl of elution buffer can be aliquoted into a 2 ml tube prior to this step.

source.description: Incubate at 37oC for 30 min. Gently aspirate and dispense the eluate over the glass beads at regular intervals with a wide-bore P1000 tip to aid elution.

Insert the bead retainer from step 15 into a clean 2 ml DNA low-bind tube.
Pour the beads and centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 30 seconds.

source.body: For cell input of more than 3 millions, centrifuge for 1 min.

source.description: Incubate the DNA at 37oC for 30 min. Gently aspirate and dispense the eluate over the glass beads at regular intervals with a wide-bore pipette tip to aid elution.

Add another 200 μl of elution buffer into the eluted DNA, pipette mix.
Incubate overnight at room temperature.

Store at 4oC or continue to UL Library Preparation as per Section "Modified ULK001".
If only SQK-RAD004 is available, follow library preparation in Section "Modified RAD004".

Follow the manufacturer’s instructions as descried
here
, BUT for one-day prep (optimized for human cells GM12878) add the changes as described in the following steps.

source.body: Our most homogeneous extracted DNA samples were obtained by lysis at 600-700 rpm speed from human cell lines. This step can be further optimised for other sample types.

source.description: Start the extraction early in the day and follow the manufacturer’s instructions.

source.body: One million cells are sufficient for one-time library load on MinION and at least two million for PromethION.

source.description: Dilute the eluted DNA with 150 μl of NEB Elution Buffer II.

source.body:
• This is following the standard protocol where DNA is eluted in 100 μl buffer. After this step, sample volume will be 250 μl total.
  • Quantification of a very viscous UHMW DNA is problematic and will not produce accurate results, hence the dilution.
  • Gradual dilution is recommended to achieve homogeneous concentration of 50-100 ng/μl.

source.description: Incubate the eluted DNA at 37oC for about 2-3 hours with regular pipette mixing.
Quantify DNA as per section "UHMW DNA QC" and check homogeneity by calculating %CV values.

Store at 4oC or continue to UL Library Preparation as per Section "Modified ULK001".
If only SQK-RAD004 is available, follow library preparation as in Section "Modified RAD004".

Follow the manufacturer’s instructions as described
here
.

Store at 4oC or continue to UL Library Preparation as per Section "Modified ULK001".
If only SQK-RAD004 is available, follow library preparation as in Section "Modified RAD004".
Quantify DNA as per "UHMW DNA QC" and check homogeneity by calculating %CV values. If the DNA is not sufficiently homegeneous, incubate the DNA for longer.

description:
This is a sub-protocol designed to extract/isolate ultra-high molecular weight (UHMW) DNA to obtain ultra-long (UL) reads on Nanopore sequencers using a phenol-free extraction method.
A DNA extraction protocol that yields clean and homogeneous UHMW DNA is important for a good UL sequencing output. The choice of protocol should be based on achieving these parameters.

Kit-free, phenol-free protocol is a modification of NEB's Monarch HMW DNA Extraction Kit for Cells & Blood, with the option to use SDS or CTAB in the lysis buffer. This protocol also uses glass beads for DNA precipitation matrix.

We tested this sub-protocol in human cell line, with input cells of 5 millions but can be varied from 1-5 millions. As a rule of thumb, a million cells will suffice for one load on a MinION.
